intro: Phagnalon schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Alpine phagnalon, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial herb with basal leaves that are typically linear or lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine meadows and grasslands. Phagnalon schweinfurthii is adapted to cold climates and is relatively drought-tolerant.
